SEARCH
Package beans.services

Class RateLimiterService

java.lang.Object
beans.services.RateLimiterService
@ApplicationScoped public class RateLimiterService extends Object
Service for limiting the rate of login attempts made by a user for a specific email. Tracks the number of attempts made by a user to login and locks them out for 5 minutes if they exceed the maximum allowed attempts (5).
Author:
Davide Scaccia - xscaccd00

    • RateLimiterService

  • Method Details

    • isAllowed

      public boolean isAllowed(String email)
      Checks if the user is allowed to login based on their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user
      Returns:
      true if the user is allowed to login, false if they are locked out

    • recordFailedAttempt

      public void recordFailedAttempt(String email)
      Records a failed attempt for the user identified by their email. If the maximum number of attempts is reached, the user is locked out for 30 minutes.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user

    • resetAttempts

      public void resetAttempts(String email)
      Resets the attempt count and lockout time for the user identified by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user

    • cleanupExpiredEntries

      private void cleanupExpiredEntries()
      Cleans up expired lockout entries from the map.

    • getRemainingAttempts

      public int getRemainingAttempts(String email)
      Gets the number of remaining attempts for the user identified by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user
      Returns:
      the number of remaining attempts

    • getLockoutEndTime

      public LocalDateTime getLockoutEndTime(String email)
      Gets the lockout end time for the user identified by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user
      Returns:
      the lockout end time, or null if the user is not locked out
